title: Fighting in Sudan Traps Families as Generals Fail to Keep a Cease-Fire
description: Terrified to step outside because of firefights and bands of armed men in the streets, residents remain stuck in their homes with dwindling supplies of food, water and medicine.

title: Joe Kennedy Treads Careful Path as U.S. Special Envoy to Northern Ireland
description: With a mandate to drum up American investment but avoid the many political pitfalls, Joe Kennedy III will need to tread carefully in Belfast.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: How Russia Gets Chips for Its Weapons
description: Also, a cease-fire fails in Sudan.

title: Freddie Scappaticci, Who May Have Been British Spy ‘Stakeknife,’ Is Dead
description: He denied that he was Stakeknife, the code name of a high-ranking British mole in the Irish Republican Army during the Northern Ireland conflict.

title: How Much Did You Spend on Your Solo Vacation?
description: We spoke to readers about their recent solo travels, including their motivations to travel alone and what they chose to spend on.

title: At Least 21 Dead After Fire at Beijing Hospital
description: The blaze appears to be the deadliest in the past two decades in the city, even though firefighters seemed to extinguish it quickly.

title: Russian Strikes Against Bakhmut Grow Fiercer, Ukraine Says
description: According to a top Ukrainian general, Kyiv’s forces remain in control in the ravaged city, the focus of months of fighting, but Russian forces are turning it “into ruins.”

title: Covid May Increase the Risk of Type 2 Diabetes, Researchers Find
description: Men and people with severe illnesses were more likely to develop the condition within a year. But the data does not prove that the coronavirus causes diabetes.

title: One Climber Dies and Another Is Missing on Himalayan Mountain
description: Noel Hanna, an experienced alpinist, was found dead at a camp after he climbed the summit of Annapurna without supplemental oxygen.

title: Sudan Live Updates: Conflicting Signs Over Humanitarian Cease-Fire
description: The Rapid Support Forces paramilitaries proposed a 24-hour pause in fighting, the longest since clashes in Sudan began three days ago. It was unclear whether Sudan’s Army would abide by it.

title: Live Updates: Putin and Zelensky Make Separate Trips to Frontline Areas
description: The visits by the Ukrainian leader, Volodymyr Zelensky, and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, seemed to be dueling displays of strength. In Moscow, a court upheld the detention of the U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich.

title: Russia Court Rejects WSJ Reporter Evan Gershkovich’s Detention Appeal
description: It was the first time Mr. Gershkovich, a 31-year-old American, was seen clearly since he was detained last month.

title: U.S. and European Officials Come Under Attack in Sudan
description: The violence against foreign officials, who are usually not targeted, highlighted how much the security situation has worsened in Khartoum in recent days.

title: Tunisia Arrests Rachid al-Ghannouchi, Leading Opposition Figure
description: Targeting Rachid al-Ghannouchi, the leader of the Islamist Ennahda party, is an escalation in President Kais Saied’s crackdown on dissent.

title: Clarence Thomas’s Gifts and the Supreme Court’s Credibility
description: Only 25 percent of Americans have a lot of faith in the court.

title: Blinken and Top Allied Diplomats Stress Unity on Russia and China
description: The foreign ministers of the Group of 7 nations discussed their shared visions on Russia’s war on Ukraine and China’s assertiveness after talk flared this month over different strategies.

title: India’s Top Court Begins Hearing Same-Sex Marriage Case
description: The Supreme Court in recent years has struck down a ban on consensual gay sex. A ruling in favor of legalizing gay unions would make India an outlier in Asia.

title: How Mexico Became the Biggest User of the Pegasus Spyware
description: A Times investigation reveals the story behind how Mexico became the first and most prolific user of Pegasus. It’s still using it, despite promising to stop.

title: The Wrong Mr. Kozlov: When Sanctions Spell Trouble for Regular People
description: After Russia invaded Ukraine, the European Union blacklisted about 1,500 people linked to the war. That has complicated the lives of those who share their sometimes fairly common names.

title: Evan Gershkovich, the Wall Street Journal reporter detained in Russia, is expected to appear in court.
Courting the Sirens of the Southern Sky
description: These days it takes a generation to build a giant telescope. A new one is taking shape in the Atacama Desert in Chile.

title: From Bullets to ‘Bird Residue,’ the Many Trials of Telescopes
description: Before an observatory can plumb the secrets of the cosmos, it must navigate more humbling challenges.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Hospitals are attacked in Sudan.

title: Who Are Sudan’s Rapid Support Forces?
description: The unit traces its origins from the notorious Janjaweed militias, which in the 2000s helped Sudan’s Army crush a rebellion in the western region of Darfur.
